title: Ticket #5373: Clean up DAGMan "node ending" code
description:
The code that deals with "node ending" events is getting more and more complicated and difficult to deal with. For example, if there's some action you need to perform when a node is finished (whether successfully or unsuccessfully) including all retries, if any, there is no clear place to do this. Things like testing whether we need to retry a node is done in a number of places, marking the node successful or unsuccessful is done in a number of places, etc.

I think that a lot of this problem is caused by the fact that some of this code dates from when things were much simpler (e.g., no pre/post scripts, no retries, no multi-proc nodes, no noop nodes, no maxidle, no DAG abort, etc.).

I'd like to see something like the following:

  • A method that's called every time one "try" of a node is finished.
  • A method that's called every time all "tries" of a node are finished.

Maybe some of the code that's now in the Dag class should get moved into the Job class.

Some of the methods that should get cleaned up:

  • Dag::PreScriptReaper()
  • Dag::TerminateJob()
  • Dag::RestartNode()
  • Dag::ProcessFailedSubmit()
  • Dag::ProcessAbortEvent()
  • Dag::ProcessTerminatedEvent()
  • Dag::ProcessJobProcEnd()
  • Dag::ProcessPostTermEvent()
  • Dag::ProcessSubmitEvent()
